intro: Tsavo ilicifolia, commonly known as the Tsavo ilex, is a shrub native to the semi-arid regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has small, glossy leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Tsavo ilicifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient component of its ecosystem.
